# autoconnect()

**Instance Method**

Automates the process of connecting or disconnecting from this connectable publisher.

## Declaration

```swift
func autoconnect() -> Publishers.Autoconnect<Self>
```

## Return Value

A publisher which automatically connects to its upstream connectable publisher.

## Discussion

Use [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/ConnectablePublisher/autoconnect()] to simplify working with [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/ConnectablePublisher] instances, such as [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/Timer/TimerPublisher] in the Foundation framework.

In the following example, the [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/Timer/publish(every:tolerance:on:in:options:)] operator creates a [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/Timer/TimerPublisher], which is a [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/ConnectablePublisher]. As a result, subscribers don’t receive any values until after a call to [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/ConnectablePublisher/connect()]. For convenience when working with a single subscriber, the [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/ConnectablePublisher/autoconnect()] operator performs the [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/ConnectablePublisher/connect()] call when attached to by the subscriber.

```swift
cancellable = Timer.publish(every: 1, on: .main, in: .default)
    .autoconnect()
    .sink { date in
        print ("Date now: \(date)")
    }
```
